issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
The SparkClientImpl will only provide a principal and keytab argument if the HADOOP_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION in hive conf is set to "kerberos". This will not work on clusters with Hadoop security enabled that are not configured as "kerberos", for example, a cluster which is configured for "ldap".

The solution is to call UserGroupInformation.isSecurityEnabled() instead.
fields.summary: SparkClientImpl checks for "kerberos" string in hiveconf only when determining whether to use keytab file.

comments.body: Is this the same as HIVE-14359, which is resolved already?

Oh! I noticed they recently changed the configuration which is being referenced from HIVE_SERVER2_AUTHENTICATION to HADOOP_SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION. This may work in the case of ldap-- although I have not tested it, so I guess the question is whether that way is preferred over UserGroupInformation.isSecurityEnabled().

Looking over the code in UserGroupInformation, it looks like both that class and hive are currently doing the same thing. In the UserGroupInformation initialize() method, there is a useKerberos boolean which is set in the case where the string is "kerberos". Do we need this code duplicated in hive?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12831609/HIVE-14888.1-spark.patch
